oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.globalSearch.ui.managed
Class GlobalSearchSessionBean

java.lang.Object
  oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.globalSearch.ui.managed.GlobalSearchSessionBean
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class GlobalSearchSessionBean
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

A Java bean stored in the JSF session for the current user using Global Search. This is the highest level construct in global search, and is responsible for the load and caching of all search related data:

  1. Search Categories,
  2. Saved Searches,
  3. Recent Searches,
  4. other minor housekeeping objects
Saved and Recent Searches are stored in the ECSF context "fnd:GLOBAL_SEARCH_CONTEXT" (the value of the GLOBAL_SEARCH_CALLER_CONTEXT constant). All CATEGORIES are loaded with scope='GLOBAL' to differentiate against other users of ECSF.

This object is stored in the current user's session, multiple uses of Global Search is made possible by using pageFlowScope stored GlobalSearchOption objects, these may be set on a per-page or per-taskflow level and act as runtime filter over the user's data.

See Also:
Serialized Form

GlobalSearchSessionBean

public GlobalSearchSessionBean()
Construct the bean. Categories and saved searches will be loaded and the default caller context set.

Method Detail

getSearchConfiguredFlag

public java.lang.Boolean getSearchConfiguredFlag()
Is search configured? A null value means it has not been tested, false value means search is not setup correctly.

Returns:
true if configured, false otherwise.

ensureConfigurationAndLoadCategories

public void ensureConfigurationAndLoadCategories()
Worker method that will test the search setup to determine if it will work, and if so load the list of categories.

This logic is deliberately separate to avoid inline loading of ECSF code which cannot be relied upon (may throw unchecked exceptions or stall for interterminate amounts of time).

getSearchableFactory

public static AbstractSearchableFactory getSearchableFactory()
Get the searchable factory that allows us to create search results.

Returns:
specific AbstractSearchableFactory.

The SearchableFactory to be used, if null defaults to ECSF. Used extensively by the unit testing framework to plug in mock factories for testing.

Parameters:
searchableFactory - factory to use. Use null to reset to the default.

public boolean containsSavedSearch(java.lang.String searchName)

searchName - name of search.

getSavedSearchById

public BaseSavedSearch getSavedSearchById(java.lang.String searchId)
Get the saved search under the given id. Note that this method ignores filters over the saved searches, so it is possible the saved search is not visible to the user, but still exists and will be returned by this method.

Parameters:
searchId - id of search.
Returns:
saved search of this name, null if not found.

Parameters:

Returns:
saved search for this index.

setTmpPersonalizeSavedSearchRenameValue

public void setTmpPersonalizeSavedSearchRenameValue(java.lang.String tmpPersonalizeSavedSearchRenameValue)
Setter for a temporary value to store what the user entered into the personalize popup when renaming a saved search. This property exists to stop the entered value from being lost between page navigations. This value should not be used in any other place besides the personalization bean.

Parameters:

Returns:

taskFlowSearch

public java.lang.String taskFlowSearch()
Backing bean method for search called in our taskflow.

Search parameters are passed as pageflowScope variables:

  1. SearchString
  2. GlobalSearchOptions
SearchString is required while GlobalSearchOptions may be left null. If it is supplied it ust be an instance of oracle.apps.fnd.applcore.globalSearch.ui.options.GlobalSearchOptions

Returns:
outcome for navigation, "ok" or "error".

performSearch

public SearchResult performSearch(java.lang.String searchString,
                                  java.util.List<SearchCategory> cats,
                                  boolean storeRecentSearch)
Perform a search from the main UIShell search area and save the result to the session.

Parameters:
searchString - user-entered search string.
cats - categories to search.
storeRecentSearch - do we store the search as a recent search.
Returns:
search performed, null if not able to perform search.

performSearch

public SearchResult performSearch(SearchFilterItems fi,
                                  boolean storeRecentSearch)
Perform a search from the main UIShell search area and save the result to the session.

Parameters:
fi - filter items, must contain keyword and category filter items.
storeRecentSearch - do we store the search as a recent search.
Returns:
search performed, null if not able to perform search.

Set the Global Search options. These options will stay in effect until changed.

Parameters:

isSavedSearchesEnabled

public boolean isSavedSearchesEnabled()
Are we showing saved searches, and can the user save a search? This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to true.

Returns:
true to use saved searches, false otherwise.

isRecentItemsEnabled

public boolean isRecentItemsEnabled()
Are we showing recent items? This is based on the SearchSuggestGroupOptions containing the recentitems group.

Returns:
true to use recent items, false otherwise.

isSubCategoriesEnabled

public boolean isSubCategoriesEnabled()
Are we showing subcategories (Searchable object) filters? This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to true.

Returns:
true to show subcategories (Searchable object) filters, false otherwise.

isFacetsEnabled

public boolean isFacetsEnabled()
Are we showing facet filters? This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to true.

Returns:
true to show facet filters, false otherwise.

isFacetCountsEnabled

public boolean isFacetCountsEnabled()
Are we showing facet count? This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to true.

Returns:
true to show facet counts, false otherwise.

getFilterLOVStyle

public GlobalSearchOptions.FilterLOVStyle getFilterLOVStyle()
Get the Filter style the user wishes to see. Currently we use LOV, but this can be set to INLINE to show the categories INLINE in the filter panel. This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to all LOV.

Returns:
Filter style, by default LOV.
See Also:
getCategoryNamesFilter()

getSearchSuggestGroupHeadings

public SearchSuggestGroup.GroupHeading getSearchSuggestGroupHeadings()
Get the Search Suggest group headings switch. This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to "on".

Returns:
group headings switch, either "on" or "off".

getSearchSuggestGroupIcons

public SearchSuggestGroup.GroupIcon getSearchSuggestGroupIcons()
Get the Search Suggest group icons switch. This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to "on".

Returns:
group icons switch, either "on" or "off".

getSearchFieldPlaceholder

public java.lang.String getSearchFieldPlaceholder()
Get the Search Search Field Placeholder (shadow) text shown when there is nothing in the search field. This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to null.

Returns:
Search Field Placeholder (shadow) text shown when there is nothing in the search field.

getSearchFieldValueMinLength

public int getSearchFieldValueMinLength()
Get the minimum number of characters that must be entered before the user can search. This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to 1.

Returns:
minimum number of characters that must be entered before the user can search.

getSearchSuggestBehaviorGroups

public java.util.List<SearchSuggestGroupOption> getSearchSuggestBehaviorGroups()
Get the Search Behavior groups. This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults based on the method GlobalSearchOptions.getDefaultGlobalSearchOptions().

No personalizations are applied to these groups, they are developer/adminisrtator values. Personalizations will be applied when the groups are initialized (when the group names are known).

Returns:
List of behavior groups.

getSearchSuggestMinCharCount

public int getSearchSuggestMinCharCount()
Get the minimum number of characters that need to be typed before search suggestions are shown to the user. This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to GlobalSearchOptions.SEARCH_SUGGEST_MIN_CHAR_COUNT_DEFAULT.

Returns:
minimum number of chars to be typed before suggest kicks in.

getSearchSuggestMaxSuggestedItems

public int getSearchSuggestMaxSuggestedItems()
Get the maximum number of suggestions shown to the user in Global Search. This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to GlobalSearchOptions.SEARCH_SUGGEST_MAX_SUGGESTED_ITEMS.

Returns:
maximum number of suggestions shown to the user.

getSearchSuggestSourceId

public java.lang.String getSearchSuggestSourceId()
Get the key the Search Suggest items are saved under in the session.

Returns:
Search Suggest Source Id.

getSearchSuggestTopSuggestions

public GlobalSearchOptions.TopSuggestions getSearchSuggestTopSuggestions()
Get the top suggestions switch for the search suggest items shown to the user in Global Search. A suggest group must support top suggestions for this to work, the default UIShell groups do not. Also note that the summary popup shown in UIShell when first clicking the search icon never supports top suggestions. This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to GlobalSearchOptions.TopSuggestions.OFF.

Returns:
top suggestions switch.

isShowLastSearchLink

public boolean isShowLastSearchLink()
Do we show the "Show results of last Search" link. This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to true. Note that the option will only show in the UI if this method returns true and ther is a most recent search to re-run.

Returns:
true if showing last search link, false otherwise.

isShowRecentItems

public boolean isShowRecentItems()
Do we show the Recent Items. This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to true. Note that the option will only show in the UI if this method returns true and there is a most recent item to re-run.

Returns:
true if showing Recent Items, false otherwise.

isShowRecentSearches

public boolean isShowRecentSearches()
Do we show the Recent Searches. This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to true. Note that the option will only show in the UI if this method returns true and there is a most recent search to re-run.

Returns:
true if showing Recent Searches, false otherwise.

isShowSavedSearches

public boolean isShowSavedSearches()
Do we show the Saved Searches. This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to true. Note that the option will only show in the UI if this method returns true and there is a saved search to re-run.

Returns:
true if showing Saved Searches, false otherwise.

isShowResultsIcons

public boolean isShowResultsIcons()
Do we show results icons if they are defined against the search actions (the iconURL attribute).

Returns:
true to show icons, false otherwise.

isClearFiltersButtonEnabled

public boolean isClearFiltersButtonEnabled()
Do we show the "Clear Filters" button on the search result page. This is based on the GlobalSearchOptions set for the current page. If no options are set it defaults to true.

Returns:
true if showing "Clear Filters" button, false otherwise.

isSearchLabelEnabled

public boolean isSearchLabelEnabled()
Is the Search Label shown.

Returns:
true if showing search label, false otherwise.

getSearchLabel

public java.lang.String getSearchLabel()
Get the Search Label.

Returns:
Label String to show.

getLastUpdateDateFilter

public java.lang.String getLastUpdateDateFilter()
Get the Last Update Date Filter.

Returns:
Last Update Date Filter.

isSearchFieldCategoryFilterEnabled

public boolean isSearchFieldCategoryFilterEnabled()
Is the search category filter is shown next to the search field in the search popover, or in the GlobalSearchField taskflow. This does not affect the category filters in the filters area of the results window.

Returns:
true if the category filters are to be shown (the default), false otherwise.

isAnySearchFieldFiltersEnabled

public boolean isAnySearchFieldFiltersEnabled()
Are any filters shown next to the search field in the GlobalSearchField taskflow used in UIShell.

Returns:
true if any are to be shown (the default), false otherwise.

isSearchFieldGroupsFilterEnabled

public boolean isSearchFieldGroupsFilterEnabled()
Is the search groups filter is shown next to the search field in the GlobalSearchField taskflow used in UIShell.

Returns:
true if the groups filters are to be shown (the default), false otherwise.

getClearSearchFieldOnSearch

public GlobalSearchOptions.ClearSearchField getClearSearchFieldOnSearch()
Do we clear the popover search field after a search. Applies to the Search popover used in UIShell, the GlobalSearchField taskflow. The default is off.

Returns:
if this field is to be cleared, false otherwise.

getSearchSuggestNoMatchMsg

public java.lang.String getSearchSuggestNoMatchMsg()
Is the no suggestions message to be shown. on by default.

Returns:
no suggestions message setting.

getSearchFieldMaximumLength

public int getSearchFieldMaximumLength()
Get the Search field maximum length.

Returns:
search field maximum length.

setShowingTabletSummaryCategories

public void setShowingTabletSummaryCategories(boolean showingCategories)
Is the tablet summary categories showing?

Parameters:
showingCategories - true if showing, false otherwise.

isShowingTabletSummaryCategories

public boolean isShowingTabletSummaryCategories()
Is the tablet summary categories showing?

Returns:
true if showing, false otherwise.

setTabletSummaryAutosuggestVisible

public void setTabletSummaryAutosuggestVisible(boolean tabletSummaryAutosuggestVisible)
Set the flag for whether the tablet summary popup autosuggest is visible. This is a temporary storage while Show Suggestions/Show Filters is toggled.

Parameters:
tabletSummaryAutosuggestVisible - true if the suggestions are to be re-shown when "Show Suggestions" is clicked.

isTabletSummaryAutosuggestVisible

public boolean isTabletSummaryAutosuggestVisible()
Is autosuggest to be re-shown when "Show Suggestions" is clicked.

Returns:
true if suggestions were shown when "Show Filters" was clicked (thus hiding the suggestions), false otherwise.

getIconFor

public java.lang.String getIconFor(java.lang.String menuId)
Get the large icon for menuId.

Parameters:
menuId - the id of the root level menu item in root_menu.xml
Returns:
large icon (or indeed any icon), or null if no icon is defined.

getLargeIconFor

public java.lang.String getLargeIconFor(java.lang.String menuId)
Get the large icon for menuId.

Parameters:
menuId - the id of the root level menu item in root_menu.xml
Returns:
large icon (or indeed any icon), or null if no icon is defined.

searchResultsPopupCancelled

public void searchResultsPopupCancelled(oracle.adf.view.rich.event.PopupCanceledEvent e)
Cancel the results popup, call the reset utilities to reset any submitted values on the popup , notably the search field input text field.

Parameters:
e - event.
